hints.content:
There are $\greenD{42}$ carrots with $\purpleC7$ carrots in each row.

![Same image with the carrots in a row numbered 1 through 7 and horizontal lines between the rows](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3457cc31a2de482ddd6c13a564ab296b3e337be5)

How can we find out how many rows of carrots there are?

We can find how many rows of carrots there are by dividing:

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\purpleC{\text{ size of the rows}}$

So, $\greenD{42}\div\purpleC{7}$

The following expression will tell us how many rows of carrots there are:

- $\greenD{42}\div\purpleC7$

question.content:
There are $42$ total carrots split into rows of $7$ carrots. 

![42 carrots with 7 carrots per row](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b4eedc16a81518e9b3399a9b82af3d0f5ada169) 

**Which expression will tell us how many rows of carrots there are?**
